result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald C. Haycraft was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No contact with victim unless approved by agent.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  

SAFE intake program or comparable program if approved by agent. 

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I/S to be used for rule violations.
I/S to be used for rule violations.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 3:52 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Alex Lech in person. Defendant FAILS to appears with Atty Kat Yanke in person; Surety Vonzell Williams appears via Zoom from MCJ. 
Date and time set for motion hearing re: returning bond to surety. 
VRCW.

COURT notes bond was already applied to fines/fees prior to the Surety's motion being filed.
ADA Lech indicates the bond that was signed does not have a surety listed.
Atty Yanke has not been able to talk to her client regarding this matter, takes no position.
Surety notes he paid the bond on the jail kiosk, also indicates he did not receive notices of the hearings in this case.
COURT addresses parties.
COURT denies motion at this time.

Adjourned: 3:57 p.m.
